td.p: Signup | Work With Us | Follow on X | Read on Web

Welcome to AlphaSignal, the most read source of news by AI engineers and researchers. Every day, we identity and summarize the top 1% of news, papers, models, and repos, so you’re always up to date. Here’s today’s roundup:
Read time: 4 min 15 sec

p.a: ▪ Anthropic rolls out hooks in Claude Code to control agent actions
▪ You can cut LLM Idle costs by 70% using automated real-time scaling
▪ Google ships Veo 3 globally for all Gemini Pro users
▪ Perplexity launches Max tier unlocking unlimited Labs and Comet access

td.p: ▪ How to Build with Llama 4, by Meta

td.p: It helps us keep this content free.

td.h2: Anthropic Rolls Out Hooks in Claude Code to Control Agent Actions

td.p: 2,464 Likes
Anthropic has added Hooks to Claude Code, giving you a way to trigger guaranteed actions instead of relying on the LLM’s choices.
You can build Hooks for notifications, approvals, lints, logging, and permission checks to secure or standardize your development workflows.

p.strong: How does it work at a high level?

td.p: Hooks run shell commands during key agent lifecycle events (e.g. before tools run, after file edits, on notifications). They receive structured JSON input and can modify Claude’s behavior, block actions, or log events.

li.p: Trigger shell commands at PreToolUse, PostToolUse, Stop, Notification, etc.
Use structured JSON to block, continue, or suppress Claude actions
Script complex workflows via full user permission execution
Example usage: run Slack alerts on task completion

td.p: Run the /hooks command in Claude Code. Select an event, add a matcher, and define a command. You can store Hooks in a project or user settings. For advanced use, write external scripts and call them inside the hook.
As Hooks run with full user permissions, they can alter files or execute destructive commands, posing a security risk.

p.i: Yeah this is better than burning a load of tokens on npm run lint

p.em: "This sounds great, thanks! It's been bugging me a little that Claude Code often does not append a newline to the end of a file, and that it often has lines with trailing whitespace. (Telling it not to do that wasn't enough.) Hooks will probably help."

td.h2: You Can Cut LLM Idle Costs by 70% Using Automated Real-Time Scaling

td.p: Most workloads spike in bursts, but your infrastructure runs 24/7, burning compute and budget.

strong.span: Cast AI’s AI Enabler scales large language models up or down instantly, saving you money every hour.

li.p: Zero-downtime hibernation cuts idle infrastructure to zero cost
SaaS fallback keeps apps running during outages
Autoscaling adapts to traffic spikes in seconds
Supports OpenAI, Anthropic, Mistral, Databricks, and more
Configure and deploy in three steps, no manual tuning required

td.p: Sign up before July 31 for three months free.

strong.a: Google rolls out Veo 3 in 159 countries, letting Pro users generate videos with sound

td.p: 3,539 Likes

strong.a: Perplexity debuts $200 Max plan so you can use frontier models, new products, and unlimited Labs

td.p: 2,639 Likes

strong.a: Sakana AI introduces AB-MCTS so you can build collaborative AI that combines strengths of ChatGPT, Gemini, DeepSeek

td.p: 1,539 Likes

strong.a: Replit adds Dynamic Intelligence allowing Agent to debug, optimize, and search the web autonomously

td.p: 1,048 Likes

strong.a: Together AI publishes Qwen3-based open-source tool, so you can build RL-tuned coding agents

td.p: 927 Likes

h2.a: How to Build with Llama 4, by Meta

td.p: 1,135 Likes

Work with Llama 4's Mixture of Experts-based models to build apps using long-context (1M+ tokens) and multimodal inputs. Learn multi-image reasoning, image grounding to identify objects and their bounding boxes, and efficient prompt formatting.
1,936 Likes

Learn how to design, structure, and evaluate context for LLM workflows.Build agent workflows using prompt chains and structured outputs. It uses concrete agent examples and practical instructions to showcase how to write effective prompts.

h2.a: Top Memory Optimization Strategies in AI Agents

td.p: 1,274 Likes

This blog post shows how to build AI memory systems using short-term, long-term, summarization, and retrieval strategies. You will learn to manage context limits, compress tokens, and store relevant conversational data.

td.h2: How to Connect Claude Code to Chrome Browser Directly

td.p: Use Playwright MCP with Claude Code to control a real Chrome window instead of a headless browser. This avoids common CAPTCHA blocks and lets you interact directly with login pages or other complex workflows.
You can authenticate in the Chrome window and keep cookies during the session.
Run this before you start Claude Code to install the browser MCP:
This registers the browser MCP in your current project directory.
Start Claude in the same directory. Claude can now use a real Chrome window.
Run browser commands. For example,

pre.code: Use playwright mcp to open a browser to example.com

td.p: Claude will open a Chrome window.
Use the Chrome window to log in. Claude continues from there. Cookies persist for the session.
